Almost all the members of this institute have administrative technical, inspectional and teaching level experience. Such experience in the field of education revenue and rural development department Some of the members have also worked and still connected with Jan Shikshan Santha (JSS) and Sate Resource Centre (SRC). JSS is working for the upliftment of the female section of the society. SRC is working in the field of literacy and Adult Education. Both the institute are working state level i.e. Maharashtra. title: Nari Samata Manch
detailsOfAchievement: Nari Samata Manch has vision of creating a just society in which equality exists in all spheres; equal opportunities, equal rights to resources, equality in justice. With focus on gender we work with men and women for gender sensitization. We work with marginalized and deprived communities for their development issues and realization of rights. Our approach is based on Democracy, Nonviolence, Secularism and scientific rational process. Our counseling center is run relentlessly for last 30 years. We provide psychological counseling from a gender sensitive perspective. The purpose is not to make only woman to adjust the situation but empower her to combat the problem as well as counseling of her counterpart to work on developing sensitive and egalitarian relationship. So far 2400 women have approached us for counseling. We also offer speak out and counseling services for men and so far 440 men have approached. We provide training on gender sensitive counseling to counselors. We also work on other issues of gender based violence such as Sexual harassment of women at workplace. We also work in rural and tribal area of Pune district for development issues such as Education of children from deprived communities, school development, Panchayat Raj Strengthening. We also work to engage rural men in reducing gender based violence.

detailsOfAchievement: The National Ecology and Environment Foundation (NEEF) provides a neutral forum, where all viewpoints of environmental management and development issues viz., technical, scientific, economic, social, and political can be addressed. The Foundation promotes environmental responsibility and provides technical and managerial leadership in the areas of Natural and Environmental Resources and their Conservation. The Foundation contributes to the issues of local and global importance in sustainable development worldwide. NEEFâ€™s major areas of Education, Research and Action are Natural Resources, Energy, Environment and Sustainable Development and its work focuses on Social, Economic, Technological and Policy aspects of these issues. The NEEF has collaborated with several individuals and organizations at the local, national and international levels. Through its objectives and activities, the NEEF is dedicated towards "A Cleaner Environment and Sustainable Development Worldwide".

detailsOfAchievement: As the output of project activities in the Baiggachak areas where organisation started its work with primitive tribal community Baiga, Grain banks and seed banks are formed and developed into functional among 50 villages. For agricultural production enhancement, land leveling, technical input incoporation and development of various kinds of water harvesting structures like, ponds, bunds, earthen dams also developed. All the activity has supported by the contribution of community level stakeholders. Education volunteers are identified among village communities and provided capacity building and skill development training for them to continuous functioning of bridge courses, adult education centers, special session for girl children and their family members to improve the level of school enrolment, retention and qualitative learning. Bio - diversity documentation programme has started throgh village level forest education group, the same group start to facilitate the process of creating awareness on Forest Right Act and its implementation in the villages. The process of Gramsabha Strengthening and formation of women SHGs had started through two governt of MP supported projects, MPRLP and TEJASWINI among 150 villages of Mandla and Dindori districts. Apart from these, MPRLP and TEJASWINI has its focus on NREGA, government level convergence, development of micro entreprises in the villages. Anoter intervention of NIWCYD is in Tourism and livelihood with the support of minstry of tourism Govt. of India and UNDP, the village where the project has launched is now elevated as one of rural tourism site by UNDP. In Urban slums and platforms, NIWCYD is running programmes for streat and slum children. The present intervention is at Jablpur, Bhopal, Katni. In Nagpur urban ares , project focus was on HIV infected groups. One significant and replicable outcome of our rural intervention is materialised in the form of Hydroulic ram with the capacity to irrigate nearly 40 acres of land in the Baigachak regions of Dindori district.

detailsOfAchievement: Achievements in 500 words. 1. A new system of 20 community toilets attached with biogas plant is developed and installed in Akoli (Jahahngir) village in Akola district. Approximately 400 people are using this toilet. The Biogas produced is used by a poor family living near the toilet area. The Biogas slurry produced is made pathogen free by Solar drying and is used as organic manure by the village people. 2. Micro â€“ Kitchen Garden Technique:- Micro kitchen garden development techniques was developed which is adopted by number of farmers in villages. This technique fulfills the need of vegetable consumption & proved very useful & nutritious to the poor families. 3. Total 837 kitchen gardens are developed in 30 villages of 3 blocks of Wardha district. Similarly kitchen gardens are also developed by school children in 11 villages of 3 blocks of Wardha district. 4. Approximately 70-75% women were found anemic ( Hb 7-( gms) in different villages before kitchen garden development. It was observed that the women who developed kitchen garden in their house and consumed ample of fresh vegetables, their haemoglobin were increased to 10-12gms in 6-8 months after regular consumption of vegetables. And this improvement remained consistently maintained and increased every year since previous 5 years. 5. A short video- film of 15 minutes is prepared to demonstrate the success stories of kitchen garden activity. 6. Experiments were made to prepare biogas food waste along with cowdung. It was observed that 100% food waste alon with only 30 % cowdung produce 82% more biogas. Based on these findings Arti model Biogas plant was installed in 3 villages of Wardha Seloo and Deoli blocks of Wardha District. The biogas plants are fully functional and used by beneficiary women after 3 years of installation even after the withdrawal of project. 7. Flower waste is collected from different temples of Wardha and converted into compost. The compost is used for kitchen garden development. 8. Vocational trainings on electric fitting and motor rewinding were organized in 6 different villages. It has provided the opportunity of self employment to rural youth. 9. Training on cutting and Tailoring were provided to young women and girls in 6 villages of Seloo block of Wardha district. After taking training approximately 12 women (2 from each village) has started their own tailoring shop in the village. This is proved to be very successful exercise for women empowerment. 10. Agro- Industry School (evening school) was organized for 2 months in one village. It was organized in total 6 villages of Seloo block of Wardha district. During this school the well established organic farmers gave both theoretical and practical training on organic farming to the local village farmers. It was also followed by the exposure visits to the organic farmers. It has created motivation and confidence in local farmers and they have started doing organic farming on part of their agricultural land.

Educating 100 Rural girls (every year), who never went to school and mainstreaming them to the governmentâ€™s education system, interventions for quality education in 30 government schools of the Rural areas, conducting literacy programmes for the leaders of POs and elected women representatives. Capacity building of young educators through trainings, workshops and creating awareness among the community through conventions, and children fairs etc. are activities of learning and teaching with the Rural children. Periodic review and term end examinations conducted jointly by the team of the Peopleâ€™s Education & Cultural Resource Unit members, PO leaders and Block Education officers/ staff. The initiative of working out a model for ensuring the reach of quality education into tribal areas is still in its infancy. We had a lot of mixed experiences, learning and challenges. About the girlâ€™s education camps: initially these girls have adjusted in the camps and have gained the confidence to speak in front of many adults. After completing the 7-month camp, and assessing their competency level, they join the regular classes of the schools Run By National Womenâ€™s welfare Society to continue their education.
